attributes.action: stop the forced deportation of Iraqi Asylum Seekers back to Iraq, and grant them the right to remain in the UK
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Iraq is in a terrible state.  The UN, various NGOs, other governments and even the British Foriegn Office recognise the dire situation in Iraq and the danger faced by the people there. The British Home Office however has started the forced deportation of Iraqi's. Those deportees face extreme danger, an uncertain future and the likelihood of being killed. If more are forced to return they too will be in danger and could be killed. We ask the government to allow Iraqi's, already here in the UK, to stay here.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "stop the forced deportation of Iraqi Asylum Seekers back to Iraq, and grant them the right to remain in the UK."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here:
